content: love squared baby blanket knitting pattern looking for a fun and easy baby blanket pattern to knit look no further than this checkered and striped colorful blanket even if you re a beginner you can create this beautiful blanket using just two basic stitches knit and purl and for more advanced knitters this pattern is still a fun and quick project project shown with approximately 100 yards each of hobby lobby s aran weight i love this yarn in rosy cheeks color a buttercup color b linen color c arctic ice color d if you would like to see more of my patterns head over to ravelry at https //www ravelry com/designers/candylou or etsy at https //www etsy com/shop/candyloucreations candyloucreations knitting blog at https //www candylou com/blog any questions please feel free to email me at creations@candylou com pattern by candylou s creations ~ www candylou com ~ ig pinterest etsy and ravelry @candyloucreations love squared baby blanket knitting pattern supplies →needles size 8 circular needles with at least a 24 cable the larger the blanket the larger the cable →yarn this blanket was knit with hobby lobby i love this yarn which is an aran weight yarn any worsted or aran weight yarn will work well for this blanket assuming a gauge of 18 stitches = 4 approximate yarn usage stroller 400 yards for 22 x 28 baby 700 yards for 28 x 36 small 1000 yards for 34 x 40 medium 1300 yards for 36 x 46 large 1600 yards 42 x 50 → stitch markers → craft needle for weaving in ends notes i recommend using stitch markers whenever the pattern calls for a change from knit to purl stitches or vice versa pick 4 colors and label them colors a b c and d to help keep track of where you are in the pattern a note about gauge using size 8 needles gauge is usually 18 stitches for 4 gauge is not important in knitting a baby blanket depending on your gauge yarn used and needle sizes this blanket may turn out larger or smaller do not be afraid to try different colors together typically bright colors go well together and pastels go well together it is your creativity that makes it special you will find tutorials on knitting purling weaving in ends yarn and needle
